activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial Scheduling Order

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn Thomas Ploof appeared by phone.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Shawn Thomas Ploof. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:35 PM Defendant Shawn Thomas Ploof in court by phone with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to attorney.  Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity: initial appearance
